error.signature: Module not found: Can't resolve 'fs' in client component

verdict.summary: Client component (use client) tries to import a Node.js-only module like fs, path, or child_process.

dead_ends.action: Polyfilling the Node.js module for the browser
dead_ends.why_fails: fs and child_process cannot be meaningfully polyfilled in browsers
fs is a built-in Node module; npm install fs installs a shim that doesn't work

workarounds.action: Move the Node.js code to a Server Component or API route
workarounds.how: Remove 'use client' from the component that needs Node.js APIs

workarounds.action: Use dynamic import with { ssr: false } if the module is only needed on the server side of the component
workarounds.how: Separate server-only logic into a separate module imported dynamically

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Module not found' indicates a Node.js module imported in a client component, while 'TypeError' indicates undefined searchParams access.
'Module not found' indicates a Node.js module imported in a client component, while 'Error' indicates invalid next.config.js options.
